fields.description:
From an external report:

{quote}
Confluence recently has been tested and, as a result, we were able to verify the existence of at least one persistent XSS vulnerability. This vulnerability is present in the Edit Attachment feature — specifically in the newFileName field — accessible through the following URL:
https://confluence/pages/editattachment.action
As a means to prove the concept proposed by this issue, we added the value "<script>alert(1)</script>file" (without quotes) in the newFileName field. Such as described in the image named xss.png (attached).
After the aforementioned insertion, the script executes successfully whenever a user visits the vulnerable page, which in turn, is available at:
https://confluence/dosearchsite.action?queryString="
As can be seen in the images named xss1.png and xss2.png (attached).
{quote}
fields.summary: XSS in newFileName Field

h3. Summary
When editing a page in IE11 with the browser resized in height, the editor footer with the "Preview", "Save", and "Close" buttons are hidden or only a part of the buttons are shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Confluence in IE11.
# Navigate to a page.
# Edit that page.

h3. Expected Results
The editor footer should be shown so the page can be saved.

h3. Actual Results
The entire editor footer is missing and the page can't be saved.

h3. Note
This works perfectly fine in Google Chrome.

h3. Workaround
None.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43158].
  {panel}

Hello,

My need would be to create and populate Confluence template page with fields from Jira issue on transition.

For example: I have created an issue in Jira, and filled some system fields and custom fields through its lifecycle. When I resolve it, during final transition, and if a certain criteria is fullfilled, I would like to have a confluence page automatically created from a given template, filled with content of choosen fields from the jira issue and linked to the issue.

It could save a lot of time when managing Knowledge databases.

Best regards.
fields.summary: Create and populate Confluence template page with fields from Jira issue on transition

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43157].
  {panel}

h5. Problem
The plugin exports its service package, so the DefaultInlineTaskService is available to other plugins. However, the com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.tasklist.search package which contains the SearchTaskParameters class is not. Since the class is not available, it is not possible to use the method InlineTaskService.searchTasks. 

h5. Suggestion
While there is probably a reason the package is private, my team was wondering if it would be possible to have the SearchTaskParameters class exported in a future version of the plugin?
fields.summary: Confluence-inline-tasks plugin, export search parameters class

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence does not clear its session during a full sync, making Hibernate track a gigantic pool of objects, i.e. synchronizing a large LDAP is virtually impossible; since it takes days to complete (even with very good hardware).
With more than 60K users the synchronization can take up to 5 days. But with flushing session and clearing it, the synchronization can be completed in 10 minutes.
h3. Environment
* All Confluence versions with crowd-api-2.8.3
* All supported databases are impacted

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.8 and set up connection to large LDAP instance
# Perform an upgrade to 5.10

h3. Expected Results
Confluence is able to finish the synchronization in couple hours
h3. Actual Results
The synchronization is taking up to 6 days

h3.Workaround
*No verified workaround available.*
[~bjarne.holen843903303] proposed to use session.flush(), session.clear() via. the HibernateTemplate after each user was synchronized.
fields.summary: Sessions are never cleared during LDAP user directory sync

h3. Summary
"Page Reload" or "Show" link for New page edits popup does not work in Internet Explorer 11
 !Notification.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* IE 11 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page in Confluence.
# Open this page in IE 11.
# Edit this page in another browser OR 
#* Add a comment in this page.
# You will receive a notification.

h3. Expected Results
Clicking either "Show" or "Page Reload" link should show the latest changes.

Clicking the link does not do anything

fields.description:
h3. Summary
  Editing Office file does not display the correct last modifier. 

h3. Environment

* Confluence 5.10
* Chrome v51.0..2704.103 
* Firefox c38.6
* Microsoft Office 2013


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach Office word in a page
# Access Confluence using two different supported browsers. 
# Login as user1 in browser1 and user2 in browser2
# Go to the page with the attached file
#- User1 opens the file in office and edit
#- User2 opens the same file in office and will received a prompt message "This file is locked for editing by another user". 
#- User2 selected *read only* and ticked the option to received notification when file is available.
# User1 updated the file, save and exit
#- Check the attachment in the page, it will show the created version 2 of the file modified by user1
# User2 gets notification to go ahead to read-write the file.
#- User2 has updated the file ,save and exit
#- Check the attachment in the page, it created a version 3 file but the modifier is user1

Steps was tested with the users being swapped around and shows the same result.

For more reference, video is attached to reproduce the issue.
fields.summary: Editing Office file does not display the correct last modifier.

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Editing a page with a large table leads to unresponsive script warning in Firefox with Windows

h3. Environment
* Firefox 47.0.1
* Windows 7
* Confluence 5.10.1
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page.
# Insert a table that has over 200 rows with over 16 columns.
# Save page.
# Edit the page

h3. Expected Results
Page editor should load normally.

h3. Actual Results
Page editor takes over 15 seconds to load and "Warning: Unresponsive script" pop up is seen with options to "Continue, Debug script, Stop script". Page finishes loading after clicking "Continue"
 
h3. Notes
* Tested with Mac OS X with Firefox 42.0 - the editor loads as expected for page with large table.

h3.Workaround
* Use a different browser to edit the page
fields.summary: Editing a page with a large table leads to unresponsive script warning in Firefox with Windows

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43106].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As more customers are adapting Letsencrypt for their SSL connections. Confluence does not support Letsencrypt structure.

h3. Suggested Solution
The way [Letsencrypt|https://letsencrypt.org/how-it-works/] is designed, there should be a way the user can enter configuration (dns record...)
As certificates only last 3 months a check is implemented
This check will also update the certificate if required (e.g. 7 days before it expires)
fields.summary: Add Support for Letsencrypt

h3. Summary

When resuming a draft, the location is not retained and the page will be published under the space homepage.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud 1000.144.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page as a child of another page.
 # Quit the page so that a draft is saved.
 # Resume editing of the draft page.
 # Publish the draft.

h3. Expected Results

The page is published as a child of the parent page defined when it was created.
h3. Actual Results

The page is being published to the homepage of the space where the draft was created.
h3. Workaround

Set the location before publishing the draft.
h3. Resolution

Upgrade to Confluence 6.11.0 or newer.

  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a space.
# Open the space and open a page there, e.g. space homepage.
# Click on the "..."-button (the action menu) in the upper right corner where you can e.g. export or delete a page.
# Open a popup, e.g. "link to this page"

*Expected result:*
The dropdown closes automatically and the popup background is grayed out.

*Actual result:*
The dropdown is still visible in the background. It only closes if the user clicks into the popup.

*Workaround:*
Click into the popup and the dropdown will close.

*Notes:*
This also affects other dropdowns in the navigation section which could be created by third party addons.
fields.summary: Dropdown list (action menu) in Confluence 5.10 is visible in popup background

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence that are deployed on SunOS have the potential to encounter this issue after they upgrade to Confluence 5.9 and above.

After the upgrade, the JIRA macro will not be able to render as per the screenshot attached below :
!jiraMacroUnableRender.jpg|thumbnail!

You can also see the following error thrown in the logs :
{code}java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class org.xerial.snappy.Snappy{code}

In addition to that you will also see the following error in the logs :
{code}[xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller] marshalInternal Error rendering macro: jira
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /app/atlassian/confluence/atlassian-confluence-5.9.3/temp/snappy-unknown-c8836370-8f1e-45b8-88dd-418fac2dc69d-libsnappyjava.so: ld.so.1: java: fatal: libstdc++.so.6: open failed: No such file or directory
{code}

the possible root-cause for this issue could be that the newer version of the confluence-jira-plugin is utilizing the snappy library but the older version of the plugin does not. We are still not able to know why SunOS does not load the library properly in this case.

h3. Workaround 1
# Shut down Confluence
# Search for libstdc++.so.6 by running the following command to find the library :
{code}cd /
find usr | grep libstdc++.so{code}
# Add the following parameters in setenv.sh or setenv.bat depending on whether you are using Windows or Linux based system :
{code}LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH":/usr/sfw/lib/amd64:/usr/sfw/lib"
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH{code}
*Please note that your path might vary, please refer to the path output in step 2 and change the path accordingly.*
# Start Confluence

h3. Workaround 2
# Upgrade to Confluence 5.10 
#  Stop your confluence
# Download this plugin [^confluence-jira-plugin-6.0.7.jar]
# Go to {{<CONFLUENCE_INSTALL>\confluence\WEB-INF\atlassian-bundled-plugins}} folder
# Remove the  confluence-jira-plugin-x.x.x.jar from the folder
# Put the new downloaded jar into the directory
# [Clear plugin cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-clear-confluence-plugins-cache-297664846.html]
# Restart the Confluence
fields.summary: Unable to render JIRA issue macro on SunOS

h3. Summary

If I add a TOC macro to the sidebar the links do not work
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 5.9.12 or Confluence 5.10.1
 # Create a page with some headings
 # Go to Space Tools>Look and Feel>sidebar, header and footer
 # Paste this into the sidebar field:
{code:java}
{toc:maxLevel=2|style=disc|indent=10px|absoluteURL=false}{code}
or even simply
{code:java}
{toc}{code}

h3. Expected Results

The links from the TOC would lead to the headings on the page
h3. Actual Results

An invalid URL is created by the links in the sidebar. Please see attached screenshots showing the TOC URLs created by:
 * clicking on a TOC macro link in a page
 !TOCpageURL5.10.1.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43087].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The configuration of the {{recently-updated-dashboard}} isn't working on the *New Dashboard* that was implemented in Confluence 5.9.

If a customer wants to restrict the content that should be displayed on the dashboard, they will not be allowed to do that. Some customers would like to hide the *Personal Spaces* of the dashboard, but this problem is preventing that.

The below workaround will not work for the new dashboard:

- [How to prevent personal spaces from being shown on the Dashboard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-prevent-personal-spaces-from-being-shown-on-the-dashboard-170493817.html]

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9 or above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the *Confluence Admin* page.
# Search for the *Layouts* option.
# Edit the *Global Layout*.
# Search for the following tag:
{code}
{recently-updated-dashboard:showProfilePic=true}
{code}
# Replace it for the:
{code}
{recently-updated-dashboard:spaces=<space-key>|showProfilePic=true}
{code}
#* Replace the _<space-key>_ parameter.
# Save and go back to the *Dashboard*

h3. Expected Results
Only the creation/updates of the chosen space will show on the *All Updates* tab.
 !old_dash.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
The *All Updates* will show all updates from all spaces, even the *Personal Spaces*.
 !new_dash.png|thumbnail! 
h3.Workaround
Use the old dashboard instead of the new one.
fields.summary: recently-updated-dashboard macro settings not working properly in the new dashboard

fields.description:
A few days before updating Confluence from 5.10 to 5.10.1, i was creating a new space {{DOCS55}}.
Then i started to copy pages from the space {{DOCS}} to {{DOCS55}}. Worked all fine, no problem.

Since the update to Confluence 5.10.1 - when i try to copy a page from {{DOCS}} to {{DOCS55}}, the UI to _{{Copy}}_ doesn't find the space {{DOCS55}}. The field to select the space is a "autocomplete select field". When i manually add the space DOCS55 and the parent page to copy to - the button _Move_ - to execute the copy is disabled.

As a consequence we cannot use the copy function anymore for the "new space".

By the way ... the issue seems a bit similar to another one - CONF-43037 - which i have reported a few days ago. 

This is really blocker for us. 
I guess i could copy pages with the CLI, i have to try it out. However, not all of our editors can use the CLI.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Clean Temporary Directory scheduled job will run even if an XML backup is running, causing the files created by the backup in the temp directory to be deleted. The backup continues even though the files are not present, and at the end of the backup process, a .zip file is created with only partial data.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run a long running backup job that will overlap with the scheduled job, Clean Temporary Directory.

h3. Expected Results
# The backup completes successfully

h3. Actual Results
# The backup beings creating the appropriate files in the temp directory
# The scheduled _Clean Temporary Directory_ job clears out the temp directory
# The backup job continues in the background and will continue to use memory and resources.
# Eventually a broken .zip file will be created
# We'll see the in-progress backup is being deleted at scheduled times, and the final .zip file is incomplete and only contains the data from the last run of the _Clean Temporary Directory_  job. It is not restorable.

h3.Workaround
Use a cron expression to set the "Clean Temporary Directory" schedule to a date in the future that will not interrupt with your backup job.
# Cog Icon > General Administration > Scheduled Jobs
# *Edit* _Clean Temporary Directory_
# Set the [Cron Expression|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF58/Scheduled+Jobs#ScheduledJobs-cronexpressions] to a time that is after your manual backup
fields.summary: XML backup job does not complete/creates corrupt backup when scheduled Clean Temporary Directory job deletes information from the temp folder
Remove double-click to select all in Code Block

fields.description:
Tomcat 8.0.33 is vulnerable to CVE-2016-3092: Apache Commons Fileupload information disclosure vulnerability

http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/www-announce/201606.mbox/%3C45A20804-ABFF-4FED-A297-69AC95AB9A3F%40apache.org%3E
fields.summary: Upgrade to tomcat 8.0.36

The following error shown in the stacktrace :
{code}Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeBatchSerially(PreparedStatement.java:2007)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeBatch(PreparedStatement.java:1443)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.executeBatch(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:1723)

h3. Environment Info
Database : MySQL ver 5.5 and 5.6.31
Confluence : 5.9.7 and 5.9.12
Transaction isolation level: READ-COMMITED

fields.description:
DB transaction for [cluster safety check job|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-cluster-issues-180847200.html] is created and committed by Spring's TransactionInterceptor.

Transaction creation and commit happens outside the cluster safety check job, so after the job has finished its work and released cluster lock, the result of the job's invocation is not committed for a short period of time.

This means it's possible that the cluster safety check job on another node is fast enough to acquire the lock and read "stale" data from the database, before the previous job has committed data into the database.
fields.summary: Race condition between hibernate and cluster lock in cluster safety manager

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create Page A and attach an image file picture.png. 
2. Create Page B, and insert picture.png that is attached to Page A
3. in Page B, copy the contents of the editor
4. Create Page C, and paste the content

*Expected result*
picture.png is displayed on the page, but not attached (it is still attached to Page A)

*Actual result*
picture.png is attached to Page C

This is going to lead to a lot of unnecessary file duplication in spaces where files are managed (e.g. not always attached to the page they are displayed on). 

A fix was made in 5.8 or 5.9 to automatically re-attach files when you copy from the editor, but it should only re-attach files that are currently attached to the source page, and ignore those that are attached to another page.
fields.summary: Copying an image in the editor does not maintain the reference to the page it was originally attached to

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43041].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If the scheduled, "Clean Temporary Directory" is running during a manual backup job, the scheduled cleaning job will clear out the temp folder, removing the entities.xml file. The Confluence backup processes continue, but no backup is created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Set Confluence to not run the Clean Temporary Directory if a backup job is in progress.

h3. Workaround 
Use a cron expression to set the "Clean Temporary Directory" schedule to a date in the future that will not interrupt with your backup job.
# Cog Icon > General Administration > Scheduled Jobs
# *Edit* _Clean Temporary Directory_
# Set the [Cron Expression|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF58/Scheduled+Jobs#ScheduledJobs-cronexpressions] to a time that is after your manual backup
fields.summary: Do not allow scheduled job "Clean Temporary Directory" to run when a backup is in progress

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43040].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Confluence should inherit the same functionalities of JIRA's user manager.
h3. Suggested Solution

There are a few functionalities in Confluence that are different in JIRA such as the way to create users with external directories or even problems regarding the emails that are sent to the created accounts.

Such problems are not present in JIRA:

- [CONF-24993 - Disable password reset when using external read only user directory|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24993]
- [CONF-43039 - Confluence sends email to reset password link for delegated users while JIRA doesn't|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-43039]

It would be better to implement the UI of Confluence and even copy the same functionalities of JIRA.

h3. Workaround 
No workarounds
fields.summary: Confluence's user manager should be the same of JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence is sending the reset password link for delegated users if the _"Send an email to the user you have just created, which will allow them to set up their password"_ option is enabled while JIRA doesn't.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

(i) You need to test in JIRA as well to see the difference

# In Confluence and JIRA, create a Delegated directory.
# In the AD, create a user.
# In Confluence and JIRA, create a new user in the Delegated Directory with the *same username* of the AD user.
# Enable the "Send an email..." option.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should inform that an account was created and the user should use the same password of the delegated directory as JIRA does:
!JIRA_email.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
Confluence sends an email to reset the password:
!Confluence_email.png|thumbnail! 
Since the passwords are managed in the AD, the user won't be able to reset it. The account is working properly but the user doesn't know that. He will try to reset the password because he thinks it needs.

h3.Workaround
- You can "uncheck" the email option while creating the user but you will have to setup the password since there are two required fields, while JIRA doesn't.
- Enable the "Copy User on Login" and do not create users directly in Confluence. 
- Manage the Confluence users with JIRA.
fields.summary: Confluence sends email to reset password for delegated users while JIRA doesn't

fields.description:
Scenario to reproduce:

You have an 'old' page named {{Foobar}}. Adding links to this page from other pages by using _Link browser > Search_ works like a charm.

Now change the title of the Foobar page to {{Foobar haz fun}}.
Afterwards, again use the Link browser from another page and try to link to the Foobat haz fun page. Now, the autocomplete menu shows the old page title {{Foobar}}. You can choose the proposed old page title, it works. You also can manually add _Foobar haz fun_ to the field, and it works as well. However, this may become very confusing.

It looks like confluence is caching the page titles and this cache is not flushed appropriately.
After "some time" all goes back to normal - it looks like the cache get flushed after some time (if there is really such a cache).
fields.summary: Link browser 'search' doesn't know a page if its title has changed recently

fields.description:
{panel:title=Fixed in Jira 8.0|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6554c0|titleBGColor=#6554c0|bgColor=#eae6ff|titleColor=#ffffff}

Closing this issue for Confluence Server and Data Center as the root cause has been resolved in Jira. JRASERVER-31977 has a workaround for Jira 7.13.x and 7.12.0 and has been fixed from Jira 8.0+. Thank you.

{panel}


As for several built-in customfield-types, Confluence seems to have trouble displaying the name of a version instead of just its ID when adding a custom version-field from JIRA as column in the JIRA macro on a Confluence-page. Please see [^jira_macro_version_customfield_only_displays_id.png]

While I can comprehend, that this is due to the fact that the JIRA Macro in Confuence pulls the data from JIRA using XML and there, only the ID is contained, it should behave exactly like the default fields for version (fixed Version, affected Version) where the names are rendered properly in the JIRA Macro on Confluence.

This renders the option of a custom version-field somewhat useless when a team relies on displaying such information on Confluence.

Tested this on Confluence 5.9.11 with JIRA 7.1.7.
 Confluence JIRA Plugin version 5.7.2
 JIRA Integration::Plugin version 3.0.2
 Confluence and JIRA Content Connector version 1.9.0

Please let me know whether you need any additional issues.

*Update and potential Workaround:*
 We have digged through the Velocity-templates that are used for the XML-Export of the issues and could find, that the xml-version.vm-Template handles the value differently than, for instance, the xml-multiselect.vm:
 *xml-version.vm*
{code:java}
#disable_html_escaping()
#if ($value)
    #foreach ($singleValue in $value)
<customfieldvalue>$!singleValue.id</customfieldvalue>
    #end
#end
{code}
*xml-multiselect.vm*
{code:java}
#disable_html_escaping()
#if ($value)
    #foreach ($singleValue in $value)
<customfieldvalue key="$singleValue.optionId"><![CDATA[$xmlutils.escapeForCdata($!singleValue.toString())]]></customfieldvalue>
    #end
#end
{code}
Adjusting the value of the customfieldvalue-Tag in the xml-version.vm accordingly, will fix the issue and render the version-name in Confluence instead of the version-ID, making the field useful within Confluence again. Please see [^jira_macro_version_customfield_after_vm_fix.png]
 The xml-version.vm looks like this now (on a JIRA 7.1.7):
{code:java}
#disable_html_escaping()
#if ($value)
    #foreach ($singleValue in $value)
<customfieldvalue key="$singleValue.id"><![CDATA[$xmlutils.escapeForCdata($!singleValue.toString())]]></customfieldvalue>
    #end
#end
{code}
It would certainly be much appreciated to have your feedback whether this is a safe workaround or expected to break things somewhere else. However as it's a customfield that's merely for personal documentation, I doubt it could have any negative impact other than maybe not being imported properly when doing an xml export and import.

Thank you for your consideration.

Regards,
 Philipp Sendek [Adaptavist]
fields.summary: Confluence doesn't display version-name but ID as value in JIRA Macro for version-customfield

fields.description:
Given the way you have to create bullet lists inside numbered lists, the process seems a bit unwieldy - there's probably a separate bug to be reported here, but I digress...

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Create an expand macro and add a bullet list inside it.
# Create a numbered list.
# In one of the steps add a new line.
# Cut and paste your expand macro inside it.
# Save the page.

*Expected outcome:*

In the numbered step with the expand macro, click the expand text and view the bullet list.

*Actual outcome:*

The bullet list is not displayed at all.

Inspecting the page using Chrome's Developer Tools, the list doesn't actually appear in the source. But looking at the Storage Format, the list is definitely there. Editing the article confirms the list is actually there. It's just never rendered.

I've had to redact the attachments somewhat showing the inspected HTML and storage format, but I've highlighted in blue where the same expand text appears in light blue. Both images should contain the list information, but you can clearly see in the HTML source that it doesn't show.
fields.summary: Bullet lists inside expand macros not displayed when part of a larger numbered list

fields.summary: Currently Unable to Load Main Page

fields.description: In a [split brain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/recovering-from-a-data-center-cluster-split-brain-656408710.html] scenario, the cluster safety job shuts down the host node and sends _ClusterPanicEvent_ to the rest of the nodes of the cluster, to bring the whole cluster down. Because of a bug that was introduced recently, _ClusterPanicEvent_ wasn't delivered to all nodes of the cluster, so they kept working, until the cluster safety job ran on each node.
fields.summary: ClusterPanicEvent is not delivered to cluster nodes

fields.description:
Hi There, 

This isn't so much a bug, but I was just wondering if there was a way you could create pages in the same space with the same name. For example, we use one space to manage invoices from different vendors, so under one vendor we might have a folder structure of "Vendor name", then "Invoices 2016" and then all invoices for 2016 under that parent page. But we can't create another "Invoices 2016" page for a different vendor, because that name is already in use. Is there a setting we can change to allow this, is this something that may be resolved in the future?

Thanks in advance, 
Daniel
fields.summary: Multiple page names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43024].
  {panel}

In order to improve the stability of Data Center, we need to understand how often our customers run into Cluster Panics. We've added a analytics event that triggers during a Cluster Panic.

The following information is collected as a part of the event:
# The clustered status of the instance (if it's actually clustered or not)
# The number of nodes present in the cluster at the time
# The maximum number of nodes allowed by your license
# The maximum number of users allowed by your license

For more information about what analytics information is collected (as well as how to disable analytics collection), please see the [Confluence Data Collection|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Data+Collection+Policy]
fields.summary: Add analytics event when cluster panics

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43018].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an admin, I would like the ability for the Confluence table columns to adjust automatically

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the columns to automatically adjust based on text size as a supplement to having to manually adjust per CONF-3393

h3. Workaround
Manually adjust the table column size

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43009].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of now, zoom in or zoom out function is not working for Confluence Mobile.
(i) Tested on iOS devices with Google Chrome and Safari.

h3. Suggested Solution
To implement zoom in/out functionality in Confluence Mobile version as well, so that user does not have to use the _Desktop Version_.
 
h3. Workaround 
To use _View Desktop Version_ feature for zooming in or zooming out.
fields.summary: Zoom In/Out Functionality in Confluence Mobile

fields.description:
I am building a plugin that has a page blueprint. The template.xml has an at:var tag that is used as a macro parameter value. When I go to admin section > Global Templates and Blueprints, and click on the Edit link, I get an error.
Macro in template.xml
{code}
<ac:structured-macro ac:name="detailssummary" ac:schema-version="2">
    <ac:parameter ac:name="firstcolumn">Release</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="headings">Category,Type, Description</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="pageSize">100</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="sortBy">title</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="label">mylabel</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="cql"><at:var at:name="myvariablename"/></ac:parameter>
</ac:structured-macro>
{code}

{code}
Error: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: Unhandled element type '{http://atlassian.com/template}var')
{code}
fields.summary: XhtmlException error when using a variable as a macro parameter in page blueprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43007].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Unable to get application version from REST API
h3. Suggested Solution

Include option in REST API to pull server info like in JIRA & Bitbucket
 http://<base-url>/jira/rest/api/latest/serverInfo
 <base-url>/bitbucket/rest/api/latest/application-properties
h3. Solution

Starting from 6.15.8, you can use the Atlassian troubleshooting plugin endpoint:
{code:java}
/rest/troubleshooting/1.0/pre-upgrade/info
{code}
This will contain the Confluence version number as well as some other useful parameters. The user needs to be authenticated to access this endpoint.
fields.summary: Get Confluence System Info from REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43004].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a user, it would be good to have all pages in Confluence be created with a specific content already on it, despite the selected template or blank page creation.
This is useful for cases where the user needs to have a macro, for example, to appear in every page footer or header.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a Global Page Template that overwrites/add to all existent definitions of new Pages in Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow users to define a base Create Page template to be used for all blueprints in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43000].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Recently updated macro does not include newly attached attachments

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Confleunce Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence
# Add the Recently Updated Macro > Edit the macro so that the Macro Configuration pops up
# In "Include these Content Types Only", add "Attachment" to limit the result to Attachments only.
 !screenshot-1.png! 
# Add attachments into the page
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results
# The newly attached attachments is included in the Recently Updated Macro

h3. Actual Results
# The newly attached attachments is *not* included in the Recently Updated Macro
# Only when the attachments is updated (by uploading a new version of the attachment) only then Recently Updated Macro will register the changes
# See screencast attached for more information

h3.Workaround
Update the attachment after uploaded, so that attachment is registered by the macro
fields.summary: Recently Updated Macro does not include newly attached macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Questions are displayed with an empty title, when you attempt to *Insert Link* into a Confluence page:
!CQ.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence Questions and create a question with the title "test"
# Create a page within Confluence, and hit the Link button to Insert a Link
# Search for "test", in the *Insert Link* dialog

h3. Expected Results
Questions should be displayed correctly in the search result with the title of the question

h3. Actual Results
Questions are displayed with an empty title
fields.summary: Confluence Questions Displayed With Empty/Blank Title In "Insert Link" Search Results
